scenes.title: The Iron Note
scenes.text: They stood before the Blackwood Ossuary. The cold was not of weather but of absence, a void that leached warmth from bone. A deep, sub-audible hum pulsed from the frozen earth, a vibration that promised dissolution. Before them, the main gate stood, a lattice of rusted iron impossibly heavy and bound by a lock green with age. The grimoire in their satchel felt like a tumor, heavy with forbidden knowledge. The Dirge had begun.

scenes.title: A Tide of Ivory
scenes.text: With a shriek of tortured metal, the lock burst. The sound, a profanity in the crushing silence, acted as a summons. The ground churned. Piles of disinterred bones, yellowed and stained with earth, surged like a breaking wave. They fused with wet cracks and snaps, assembling into a multi-limbed horror of clicking femurs and grasping phalanges. It was a swarm given singular, hateful purpose, and it scrambled towards them with the unnatural speed of a collapsing star.

scenes.title: The Silent Admonition
scenes.text: They found a breach in the wall, a wound of collapsed masonry, and slipped through. Here, the tombstones leaned at impossible angles, etched with looping sigils that seemed to writhe in the candlelight. A whisper, not of air but of stone grinding on stone, entered their mind. It spoke without language, a direct transmission of dread. The hum was not a summons to power, but the resonant frequency of a cage's bars. They were not opening a door; they were becoming a key for that which was locked away.

scenes.title: Hypocenter of the Dirge
scenes.text: They reached the heart of the cemetery, a ring of cyclopean monoliths. The hum was a physical blow now, a force that vibrated loose their teeth. The dead clawed from their graves, skeletons draped in rotted shrouds, their bones glowing with an internal, ember-like light. They moved like marionettes, their heads lolling. In the center of the ring, the earth had collapsed into a pit of roiling, liquid darkness. The final incantation screamed from the page, demanding a sacrifice of will and flesh to complete the circuit.

scenes.title: Ashes and Silence
scenes.text: They threw the grimoire into the candle's flame. The ancient pages did not burn but sublimated, screaming with a chorus of alien voices as they turned to black smoke. The Marrow-Humming Dirge ceased. The cold, a palpable entity moments before, vanished, replaced by a simple, mundane chill. The silence was absolute. They fled the Blackwood Ossuary, leaving the gate to that other place closed. But the memory of the hum would forever nestle behind their eyes, a promise of the vast, hungry emptiness between worlds.

scenes.title: An Ageless Chorus
scenes.text: They sliced their palm, the blood a stark crimson against the night. As the first drop hit the roiling darkness, the hum became a deafening, reality-bending roar. The liquid shadow surged upwards, a living tsunami that enveloped them. The pain was an eternity. Their flesh was unmade, boiled away and rendered down to constituent atoms. Their skeleton, now glowing with the same hellish orange light, stepped forward to join the silent, endless procession. Their consciousness became a single, screaming note in a choir that will sing until the stars die.

scenes.title: The Unmaking Word
scenes.text: They rejected the text's command. With hands that shook from the sheer cosmic pressure, they carved a counter-sigil into the nearest monolithâ€”a symbol not of opening, but of closing. The silver athame sparked against the ancient stone. A sound like a dying galaxy shrieked from the pit. The hum inverted, becoming a null-frequency that shattered the animate dead into heaps of bone dust, their inner light extinguished. The oppressive presence vanished. They had stared into the abyss and slammed the door shut.
